item.title: Epic Games Store’s Black Friday & Cyber Monday Sale Sees Premium Edition Prices Slashed
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/epic-games-stores-black-friday-cyber-monday-sale-sees-premium-edition-prices-slashed/

If you're looking for games to play, or you've had certain titles on your wishlist for a long time, now is the perfect time to check them out on the Epic Games Store. The Black Friday - Cyber Monday Premium Editions Sale has just started over at the Epic Games Store, which sees games like Star Wars Outlaws, Cyberpunk 2077, and Frostpunk 2's Deluxe Editions all on sale for a discounted price. These editions have extra goodies that you can get to enhance your game or your overall experience with the franchise. For example, some premium editions will have season passes for additional content that is either out right now or plans to be released later down the line. Alternatively, some may provide you with costumes, digital art books, or soundtracks to listen to.

The sale has just started today and will be running through to December 3, ending at 11 AM ET / 4 PM GMT / 5 PM CET. By purchasing games in the Premium Editions Sale, Epic Games is giving you the biggest bang for your buck, as you'll be able to get all of the available content in a game or all extra add-ons and cosmetics for a lower price than usual.

In case you find yourself unsure of what you can get in the Epic Games Premium Editions Sale, the Epic Games store has released a buyer's guide with some of the top titles right now, as well as some indie games that have the potential to be your latest obsession.

With this sale, you can see games reach a historically low price, with The Casting of Frank Stone Deluxe Edition getting a significant discount since its release. If you're looking for a horror game to play where your choices matter, you can nab this title with a 30% discount, bringing the price down to $34.99.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit unusual, you can get the Ultros Deluxe Edition with a 50% discount, taking you into a psychedelic landscape, with the Deluxe Edition providing you with the Digital Artbook and Original Soundtrack.

The Epic Games Store Black Friday - Cyber Monday sale can also net you great games such as Trepang2 Deluxe Edition, MechWarrior5: Clans Digital Collectors Edition and The Sinking City Deluxe Edition.

Will you be picking up anything in this sale? Let us know in the comments what games have caught your eye.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Reportedly Conducting Largest Franchise Playtests to Ensure the Game’s Success
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/battlefield-6-reportedly-conducting-largest-franchise-playtests-to-ensure-the-games-success/

Battlefield 6 simply cannot repeat the mistakes of the recent past. The last truly successful entry in the first-person shooter franchise was 2016's World War One-themed Battlefield 1, which surpassed the combined sales of BF4 and Hardline in its first week. Overall, it sold over 15 million units.

Then there was the World War Two-themed Battlefield V, which got a far more mixed reception and lower sales than Electronic Arts had anticipated. Three years later, DICE released Battlefield 2042. Set in the near future, the game had several technical issues, which the developer partly blamed on having to work remotely due to the COVID-19 pandemic. At launch, it ditched the franchise's class system in favor of Operators; however, due to fan backlash, the class system was later reinstated.

Ultimately, BF 2042 didn't resonate with the community, and EA put Respawn's Vince Zampella in charge of the franchise going forward, with the goal of rethinking the development process for future games from the ground up.

According to Tom Henderson, this includes conducting the largest playtests in the franchise's history. In a new report published today on Insider Gaming, Henderson says external playtests are happening a lot more frequently than they did in the past, and the team has already collected a massive amount of data. The insider also suggests EA and DICE might be looking to reactivate the Battlefield Community Test Environment, though there are no concrete details at the time.

Battlefield 6 will take place in a modern setting, featuring the most realistic and exciting destruction effects in the industry - or so a job advertisement claimed, anyway. As for the estimated release window, Tom Henderson previously reported that DICE and EA are targeting next Fall, more specifically October. The last two games were released in November, after Call of Duty, whereas Battlefield 1 beat Infinite Warfare to the punch with an October 20 release date. We might see a repeat of that. According to that rumor, the game will also include a free-to-play Battle Royale mode at launch.
